Name: Installing Python with Visual Studio Code and setting up Visual Studio Code to run Python
desc: In this video, I have shown you how to install Python with Visual Studio Code
content:
To run Python in your system, you have to install 2 things

  • Python Interpreter - which runs our codes and gives output
  • Integreted Development Envirment (IDE) - Which gives us a good enviroment to write codes and decrease the efficient to our codes.

In this course we will use Visual Studio Code as an IDE

Open Your Web Browser
Go to python.org
Download the latest version as per your system configuration
Open the Setup and Install it

Now we have to install the IDE

Go to https://code.visualstudio.com/
Download the Setup and install it

Now you have successfully installed python Interpreter and VS Code in your system

Name: Print() function in Python
desc: In this Video, I have shown you how to print a text in python and how to use print() function in Python to print a text
content:
Whenever you learn a new programming language, first you have to learn how to print any word text number. To do so in Python we use print() function

Syntax (rules) to print statements

First write print()
Inside parentheses type anything that you want to print under quotes.

Source Code

print("hello world")
print("this is my first programme in python")

Name: Variables in Python
desc: In this video, I have shown you What variable actually is and how to make them in Python
content:
The word variable in programming describes a place to store information such as numbers, text, lists of numbers and text, and so on. Another way of looking at a variable is that it’s like a label for something.
For example, to create a variable named fred, we use an equal sign (=) and then tell Python what information the variable should be the label for. Here, we create the variable 'a' and tell Python that it labels the name "hello world" or anything else (note that this doesn’t mean that another variable can’t have the same value)

Syntax to make variables in python

First write the name of the variable

There are many rules for name the rules :-

  • Variables don't starts with numbers but you can use numbers between or end in a variable
  • Variables don't contain a special characters
  • Variables don't contain spaces (You can use underscore sign (-) instead of spaces)

Label the data that you want to store in that variable with equal to sign (=)
a = "hello world"

Now you can print the variables just by writing the variable without any quotes in print() function

Rewrite the variable value

To rewrite the variable value you can just write the name of the variable and the value that you want to change seperating with equal to sign (=)

a = "Hello World"
a = "Hi World"

Source Code

var = "hello world"
var2 = 2323

print(var)
print(var2)

# rewriting variable
var = 1290
print(var)

total_amounts = 1234
print(total_amounts)

Name: Datatypes in Python - Numeric Datatype
desc: In this video, I have shown you what Datatypes actually is and have discussed some numeric datatypes in Python
content:
Datatypes in Python

Datatypes means the types of data that we store in a variable
Types of Datatypes in Python
  • Numeric
  • Sequence
  • Boolean
  • None
  • Dictionary or Maps
  • Sets
Numeric Datatype
Numeric Datatype is divided into three types
  • Int
  • Float
  • Complex
Sequence Datatype
Sequence Datatype is divided into three types
  • Strings
  • List
  • Tuple

None Datatype

None Datatype are the type of data which contain Nothing
You can assign any variable to None by just writng the variable name and None seperating with equal to sign (=)
a = None

Numeric Datatypes

Int
Int datatypes are the type of data which contain integer like -12, 84, 23, etc..
You can assign any variable to int with the variable name and any Integers seperating with equal to sign (=)
a = 233
print(type(a))
Determining the Datatype of any variable
To determing the datatype of any variable we use type() function where we have to write the variable name in the parantheses

Float
Float datatypes are the type of data which contain decimal value like -12.8, 84.6, 23.94, etc..
You can assign any variable to float with the variable name and any decimal value seperating with equal to sign (=) 
a = 233.34
print(type(a))

Complex
Complex Datatypes are the type of Data like in Maths we have complex number which represented as a + bi
a = 3+4j
print(type(a))

Where a is the real number and bi is the imaginary part and i = underoot -1
In python we have a + bj where a is real number and bj is imaginary part and j = underoot -1

Calculations with Numeric Datatype

We can do any type of Calculations with the Numeric Datatype
To do so :
We have to write print() function under parenthese we have to write the Calculation without quotes
a = 84
b = 85
print(a + b)
print(a - b)
print(a * b)
print(a / b)
Source Code
# int or integer value
a = 89
print(a)
print(a + 89)

# float or decimal value
num1 = 2.1
print(type(num1))
print(num1 // 10)

# complex type

num1 = 3 + 4j
num2 = 6 + 8j

print(num1 / num2)

Name: Datatypes in Python - String Datatype
desc: In this video, I have shown you what String actually is in Python
content:
In programming terms, we usually call text a string. When you think of a string as a collection of letters, the term makes sense. All the letters, numbers, and symbols could be a string. For that matter, your name could be a string, and so could your address. In fact, the first Python program we used a string: “Hello World.”
Strings are only in quotes that quotes may be double quotes (" ") or single quotes (' ')
a = "Hello world"
print(a)
print(type(a))

You can write the variable name and a string seperating with a equal to sign (=)

Concatenating string
if you want to concatanate ( adding two or more strings ) a and b variable as follows : 
a = 'Strings in'
b = 'Python'
print(a + b)
Embedding Strings
To embed the string we use placeholders that is %s
a = "I have Scored"
b = "1000 points"

print("I have Scored %s" % b) # %s is use to embed strings`

We can't take calculation like subtraction, division of strings
Source Code
a = "this is the tutorial of strings"
print(a)
print(len(a)) # len function is used to find the lenght of the strings alongwith spaces
print(a[1]) # square brackets is used to find the word in the 1 number (index is start with 0)

print(a * 100) # prints a variable 100 times
a = "this is the tutorial of \n strings" # \n is used to make a new line
a = "hello"
b = "world" 
print(a + b) # concatanate variable a and b

a = "I have Scored"
b = "1000 points"
print("I have Scored %s" % b) # %s is use to embed strings

Name: Datatypes in Python - More on Strings
desc: In this video, I have shown you more about Strings and have shown you how you can solve the error with strings in Python
content:
Assigning a paragraph in a variable

If you want to assign a paragraph into a variable like in this example :-
a = "This is a string
is running in vs code 
this is python programming"
If you run it you will see End Of Line (EOL) error, means that in the first line we have used double quotes to assign but when python runs this code it has not found the ending double quotes in the end of line

To solve this problem you can use multiline quotes(''' paragraph here ''') like in this example :
a = '''This is a string 
this is running in vs code 
this is python programming'''
print(a)

When you run it you will not get any error and the paragraph will print successfully

Problems with Assigning strings

Now In this example there's an error with this code
a = "I said,"I am running python in VS code""
print(a)
When you run it, it has an error because we use double quotes to assign the variable and then we also use a double quotes in the variable so where the double quotes is in the variable python found that the strings are ended with the endeing quotes
To solve this problem you can use single quotes('') to make this variable like:
a = 'I said,"I am running python in VS code"'
print(a)

But there's an another way to solve this problem we can use slash(\) in every quotes in the strings like:
a = "I said,\"I am running python in VS code\""
print(a)
When you run it you will not found any error because python ignores that quotes inside the strings

Now if you want to run the print function to print everything in the same line like in this examples when you run it, it will print everything in the new line
a = "I have scored"
b = "10000points"
print(a)
print(b)

Output is as follows:-
I have scored
10000 points

To print in the same line you can use print(a , end=" ") where end=" " in the line means that this line will end with space not enter. Like in this example:-
a = "I have scored"
b = "10000points"
print(a, end=" ")
print(b)

Escape Sequences

In many programming languages including python and command line interfaces, the escape sequences are used in character literals (literals are basically corresponds to a short and easy way to specify a value) and string literals, to express characters which are not printable or clash with the syntax of characters or strings.

There are so many types of Escape Sequences in Python:-

Escape sequenceMeaning
\’This represents a single quote
\nThis represents a newline
\rThis represents a carriage return
\tThis represents a tab
\bThis represents a backspace
\fThis represents a formfeed
\oooThis represents an octal value
\xhhThis represents a hex value
\\This represents a backslash
\uxxxxThis represents 16 bits value
\uxxxxxxxxThis represents 32 bits value
Source Code
a = '''This is a string
this is running in vs code
this is python programming'''
print(a)
print(type(a))

a = 'I said,"this is ram\'s book"'
b = "Yes"
print(a, end=" ")
print(b)

Name: Datatypes in Python - List Datatype
desc: In this Video, I have shown you what is list datatypes in python and some function
content:
Lists Datatypes are the type of Data which include 2 or more amount of data
Lists are always in square brackets([ ])
You can make the list by just naming the variable and a list seprating with equal to sign (=)
a = ["C", "C++", "Python", "Java"]
print(type(a))

Printing the list items in python

Lists start at index position are like position of strings where the first item in a list is 0, the second is 1, and the third is 2 and so on

Now if you want to print first place of the item of the variable a that is a List.
To print any list item of the list can use print(a[ ]) under square brackets type the index no. of that item in the List
a = ["C", "C++", "Python", "Java"]
print(a[0])

Rearranging the places of items in List

To rearrange the items in the list you just have to write the name of the list and in square brackets type the index place of the item to change and type equal to(=) and name that you want to change
a = ["C", "C++", "Python", "Java"]
a[1] = "Java"
a[3] = "C++"
print(a)

Adding Items to a List

To add items to a list, we use the append function. A function is a chunk of code that tells Python to do something. In this case, append adds an item to the end of a list.
a.append('Swift')
print(a)

Removing Items from a List

To remove items from a list, use the del command (short of delete). For example, to remove the fourth item in the a named List, Swift, do this:
del a[4]
print(a)

Calculations with lists

We can add them using print and the + sign, like so:

We can also add the two lists and set the result equal to another variable.
# We can add them using print and the + sign, like so:
list1 = [1, 2, 3, 4]
list2 = ['I', 'tripped', 'over', 'and', 'hit', 'the', 'floor']
print(list1 + list2)

# output is this = [1, 2, 3, 4, 'I', 'tripped', 'over', 'and', 'hit', 'the', 'floor']

# We can also add the two lists and set the result equal to another variable.
list1 = [1, 2, 3, 4]
list2 = ['I', 'ate', 'chocolate', 'and', 'I', 'want', 'more']
list3 = list1 + list2
print(list3)

# And we can multiply a list by a number. For example, to multiply list1 by 5, we write list1 * 5:
list1 = [1, 2]
print(list1 * 5)
# This is actually telling Python to repeat list1 five times,

# Output is this =  1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 2

And we can multiply a list by a number. For example, to multiply list1 by 5, we write list1 * 5: And we see that the list is now printed 5 times. On the other hand, division (/) and subtraction (-) give only errors

Source Code

a = ["C", "C++", "Python", "Java"]
print(type(a))
print(a)

print(a[1]) # print the index no. item of the list
# print(a[4])

a[1] = "Java"
a[3] = "C++"
# print(a)
a[1] = "C++"
a[3] = "Java"
print(a)

a.append("Swift")
# print(a)

a[4] = "Java"
a[3] = "Swift"
# print(a)

del a[3]
print(a)

list1 = ["I", "have", "scored"]
list2 = [10000, "points"]

list1 = [10000, "points"]

print(list1 + list2)
print(list2 * 12)
# print(list2 - 20) When you run this line you will get an error because we can't take subtraction and division of List

Name: Datatypes in Python - Tuple Datatype
desc: In this Video, I have shown you what tuple is in python
content:
Tuples are used to store multiple items in a single variable.
Syntax to make tuples in python
a = ("apple", "banana", "cherry")

print(a)
print(type(a)) # when you run it you will see
Tuples are immutable
Tuples are immutable because we can't change the items of the tuples where we can change the items in Lists

More on tuples
Source Code
a = (89, "tuple", 69)
print(a)
print(type(a))
print(a[0])

Name: Datatypes in Python - Boolean Datatype
desc: In this Video, I have shown you what is Boolean datatypes in python and some function
content:
Boolean Datatypes are the type of Data which include the True or False like:
-34 is greter than 54 - False
33 is lesser than 53 - True
33 is equal to 34 - 1 - True
etc.

In python we say this kind of logic is called boolean. So, to do so in python we use bool() function like This
Now if you want to make a variable contains boolean dataypes. like this: -
print(bool(87876 > 87)) # the output is True
print(bool 34 == 35 - 1) # we use double equals to when we want to use equal to in the boolean statements

Calculations of boolean Datatypes
If you heared about binary language which is a computer language. There are only two numbers in binary language which are 0, 1

Where 0 is False and 1 is True, So, By Knowing this you can know how the Calculations works of boolean datatype like if you make the variable like this:

Now if you want to calculate like print(a + b) the operation is like this the value of a is False and which is 0 and b is True or 1 now if you want to add a + b which is 0 + 1 which equals to 1-

Like this you can do substraction, multiply and divide the boolean Datatypes
a = 34 > 56 # returns False or 0
print(a)
b = 3434 == 3436 - 2 # returns True or 1
print(b)
a = 34 > 56 # returns False or 0
print(a)

b = 3434 == 3436 - 2 # returns True or 1
print(a + b) # returns 1

Name: How to Send Form to Gmail using JavaScript
desc: In this Video, I have shown you how you can make a working Contact Us using just only HTML, CSS, JS
content:
Source Code

index.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Contact Us</title>

    <style>
        * {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
        }

        h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, span, p {
            font-family: sans-serif;
        }

        h1 {
            font-size: 40px;
        }

        body {
            background-color: #E9ECEF;
        }

        #load {
            transition: 2s;
            margin-top: 5px;
            margin-bottom: 1px;
            position: absolute;
            left: 110px;
            width: 25px;
            height: 25px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            border: grey solid 5px;
            display: none;
            outline: none;
            border-top: lightskyblue 5px solid;
            animation: loading infinite 0.6s;
            animation-timing-function: linear;
        }

        @keyframes loading {
            from {
                transform: rotate(0deg);
            }

            to {
                transform: rotate(360deg);
            }
        }

        .contact {
            margin-bottom: 30px;
            /* position: relative; */
            min-height: auto;
            padding-top: 40px;
            padding-right: 100px;
            padding-left: 100px;
            padding-bottom: 20px;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            flex-direction: column;
            background: url();
            background-size: cover;
        }

        .contact .content {
            max-width: 800px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .contact .content h2,
        .contact .contact h1 {
            font-size: 36px;
            font-weight: 500;
            color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
        }

        .contact .content p {
            font-weight: 300;
            color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
        }

        .containor {
            width: 100%;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            margin-top: 30px;
        }

        .containor .contactinfo {
            width: 50%;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
        }

        .containor .contactinfo .box {
            position: relative;
            padding: 20px 0;
            display: flex;
        }

        .containor .contactinfo .box {
            min-width: 60px;
            height: 60px;
        }

        .containor .contactinfo .box .text {
            display: flex;
            margin-left: 20px;
            font-size: 16px;
            color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
            flex-direction: column;
            font-weight: 300;
        }

        .box {
            display: block;
        }

        .containor .contactinfo .box .text h3 {
            font-weight: 500;
            color: #00bcd4;
        }

        .contactForm {
            width: 50%;
            padding: 70px;
            background: #fff;
        }


        .contactForm h2 {
            font-size: 30px;
            color: #333;
            font-weight: 500;
        }

        .contactForm .inputBox {
            position: relative;
            width: 100%;
            margin-top: 30px;
        }

        .contactForm .inputBox input,
        .contactForm .inputBox textarea {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 5px 0;
            font-size: 16px;
            margin: 10px 0;
            border: none;
            border-bottom: 2px solid #333;
            outline: none;
            resize: none;
        }

        .contactForm .inputBox span[class=span] {
            position: absolute;
            left: 0;
            padding: 5px 0;
            font-size: 16px;
            margin: 10px 0;
            pointer-events: none;
            transition: 0.5s;
            color: #666;
        }

        .contactForm .inputBox input:focus~span,
        .contactForm .inputBox input:valid~span,
        .contactForm .inputBox textarea:focus~span,
        .contactForm .inputBox textarea:valid~span {

            color: #000000;
            font-size: 12px;
            transform: translateY(-20px)
        }

        .contact p,
        .contact h2,
        .contact h3 {
            z-index: -2;
        }


        .contactForm .inputBox button[type="submit"] {
            opacity: 0.6;
            width: 100px;
            background: #00bcd4;
            color: #fff;
            border: none;
            cursor: pointer;
            padding: 10px;
            font-size: 18px;
            transition: all ease 0.5s;
        }

        .contactForm .inputBox button[type="submit"]:hover {
            transition: 0.3s;
            opacity: 1;
        }



        @media (max-width: 800px) {
            .contact {
                padding-left: 10px;
                padding-right: 10px;
            }

            .containor {
                flex-direction: column;
            }

            .containor .contactinfo {
                margin-bottom: 40px;
            }

            .containor .contactinfo {
                padding-left: 10px;
                width: auto;
            }

            .contactForm {
                /* padding-left: 50px; */
                width: auto;
            }
        }

        @media (max-width: 352px) {
            .containor .contactinfo .box {
                display: none;
            }
        }

        @media (min-width: 353px) {
            .containor .contactinfo .box {
                display: block;
            }
        }
    </style>
</head>

<body>
    <!-- Contact_us starts-->
    <section class="contact">
        <div class="content">
            <h1>Contact Us</h1>
            <div class="h3">
                <h2 style="font-weight: 100; padding-top: 20px;">Want to Contact Us</h2>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class="containor">
            <div class="contactForm">
                <form action="javascript:sendemail()" method="POST" id="form">
                    <h2>Send Message</h2>
                    <div class="inputBox">
                        <input type="text" name="Name" id="Name" required="required" autocomplete="off" placeholder="Full Name">
                    </div>
                    <div class="inputBox">
                        <input type="text" name="Email" id="Email" required="required" autocomplete="off" placeholder="Email ID">
                    </div>
                    <div class="inputBox">
                        <textarea type="text" required="required" name="message" id="message" autocomplete="off" 
                        placeholder="Type your Message"></textarea>
                    </div>
                    <div class="inputBox">
                        <button type="submit" value="Submit" class="button">
                            submit
                        </button>
                        <span id="load"></span>
                    </div>
                </form>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <!-- contact us ends -->

    <!-- script starts -->

    <!--this is essential to link this smtp and jquery cdn link-->
    <script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-2.2.4.min.js"
        integrity="sha256-BbhdlvQf/xTY9gja0Dq3HiwQF8LaCRTXxZKRutelT44=" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>

    <script src="https://smtpjs.com/v3/smtp.js"></script>
    <!--this is essential to link this smtp and jquery cdn link-->

    <script>
        function sendemail() {
            var name = $('#Name').val();
            var email = $('#Email').val();
            var message = $('#message').val();
    
            var Body = 'Name: ' + name + '<br>Email: ' + email + '<br>Message: ' + message;
            Email.send({
                SecureToken: "Your SecureToken",
                To: 'youremail@gmail.com',
                From: "youremail@gmail.com",
                Subject: "New message on contact us form ",
                Body : Body
            }).then(
                message => {
                    //console.log (message);
                    if (message == 'OK') {
                        window.location.replace("thankyou.html")
                    }
                    else {
                        console.error(message);
                        window.location.replace("error.html")
                    }
                }
            );
        }
    </script>

    <script>
        document.getElementById("form").onsubmit = function () {
            document.getElementById('load').style.display = "inline"
        }
    </script>
    <!--script ends-->
</body>

</html>`
thankyou.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Thankyou For Contacting</title>
    <style>
        *{
            padding: 0;
            margin: 0;
        }
        body {
            transition: 1s;
            background-color: #E9ECEF;
        }

        .anchor {
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            position: relative;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .anchor a {
            position: relative;
            top: 20px;
            text-decoration: none;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            font-family: sans-serif;
            padding: 10px;
            color: white;
            font-size: large;
            font: bold;
            margin-bottom: 10px;
            margin-right: 10px;
            margin-left: 10px;
            border: transparent 2px solid;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.5;
        }


        .anchor a:hover {
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.8;
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(1) {
            background-color: rgb(18, 165, 18);
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(2) {
            background-color: rgb(243, 74, 74);
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(3) {
            background-color: rgb(49, 165, 238);
        }

        .h1 {
            margin-top: 40px;
            font-size: 85px;
            color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
            font-weight: bold;
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            position: relative;
        }

        .h1 h1 {
            display: block;
            position: relative;
            top: 150px;
            text-decoration: none;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            font-family: sans-serif;
            padding: 10px;
            color: white;
            font-size: large;
            font: bold;
            margin: 10px;
            border: transparent 2px solid;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.5;
        }

        .thankyou #okay {
            display: block;
            color: green;
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
            font-style: italic;
            font-size: 30px;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            position: relative;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .thankyou #namedrf {
            text-transform: capitalize;
            margin: 0 15px;
            position: relative;
            color: #6c757d;
            font-size: 1.50rem;
            text-align: center;
            font-weight: 300;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            margin-bottom: 0.25rem;
            display: block;
            line-height: 1.5;
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe ", Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", 
            Arial, "Noto Sans", sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", 
            "Segoe UI Symbol", "Noto Color Emoji" 
        }

        .thankyou #namedrf2 {
            text-transform: capitalize;
            margin-left: 15px;
            margin-right: 15px;
            position: relative;
            color: #000000;
            font-size: 1.50rem;
            text-align: center;
            font-weight: 300;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            margin-bottom: 8.25rem;
            display: block;
            line-height: 1.5;
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", 
            Arial, "Noto Sans", sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", 
            "Segoe UI Symbol", "Noto Color Emoji" 
        }


        @media (max-width:761px) {
            .h1 {
                font-size: 50px;
            }


            .errorways {
                font-size: 15px;
            }

            .thankyou #okay {
                font-size: 25px;
            }
        }

        @media (max-width:576px) {
            .thankyou #okay {
                font-size: 30px;
            }
        }

        @media (max-width:284px) {
            .anchor {
                margin-bottom: 30px;
            }

            .thankyou .h1 {
                display: none;
            }

            .thankyou #okay {
                margin-top: 30px;
            }

        }
    </style>
</head>

<body>
    <section>
        <div class="thankyou">
            <h1 class="h1">
                Thank You for Contacting Us
            </h1>

            <p id="okay">
                Your message has been sent successfully!
            </p>

            <p id="namedrf">Your Company or Website name</p>

            <div class="anchor">
                <a href="#">Watch Videos</a>
                <a href="#">Back To Home</a>
                <a href="#" target="_blank"
                    rel="noopener noreferrer">Watch On youtube</a>
            </div>
            <p id="namedrf2">We will reply you to your entered Email</p>
        </div>
    </section>
</body>

</html>
error.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Error while sending mail</title>
    <style>
        *{
            padding: 0;
            margin: 0;
        }
        body {
            transition: 1s;
            background-color: #E9ECEF;
        }

        .anchor {
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            position: relative;
            /* margin-bottom: 70px; */
        }

        .anchor a {
            position: relative;
            top: 20px;
            text-decoration: none;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            font-family: sans-serif;
            padding: 10px;
            color: white;
            font-size: large;
            font: bold;
            margin-bottom: 10px;
            margin-right: 10px;
            margin-left: 10px;
            border: transparent 2px solid;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.5;
        }


        .anchor a:hover {
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.8;
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(1) {
            background-color: rgb(18, 165, 18);
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(2) {
            background-color: rgb(243, 74, 74);
        }

        .anchor a:nth-child(3) {
            background-color: rgb(49, 165, 238);
        }

        .h1 {
            margin-top: 20px;
            font-size: 85px;
            color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
            font-weight: bold;
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            display: block;
            position: relative;
        }

        .h1 h1 {
            position: relative;
            top: 150px;
            text-decoration: none;
            text-transform: uppercase;
            font-family: sans-serif;
            padding: 10px;
            color: white;
            font-size: 85px;
            font: bold;
            margin: 10px;
            /* margin-bottom: 100px; */
            border: transparent 2px solid;
            border-radius: 10px;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            transition: 0.7s;
            opacity: 0.5;
        }

        .thankyou #okay {
            color: red;
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
            font-style: italic;
            font-size: 28px;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            text-align: center;
            display: flex;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            position: relative;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .thankyou #namedrf {
            text-transform: capitalize;
            margin: 0 15px;
            position: relative;
            color: #000000;
            font-size: 1.50rem;
            text-align: center;
            font-weight: 300;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            margin-bottom: 0.25rem;
            display: block;
            line-height: 1.5;
            margin-top: 30px;
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, 
            "Helvetica Neue", Arial, "Noto Sans", sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", 
            "Segoe UI Emoji", "Segoe UI Symbol", "Noto Color Emoji" 
        }

        .errorways {
            position: relative;
            color: #6c757d;
            font-size: 20px;
            font-weight: 300;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            text-align: center;
            display: block;
            /* line-height: 1.5; */
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, 
            "Helvetica Neue", Arial, "Noto Sans", sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", 
            "Segoe UI Emoji", "Segoe UI Symbol", "Noto Color Emoji" 
        }

        .thankyou .errorway2 {
            margin-top: 50px;
        }

        #youtubecontact {
            text-decoration: none;
            color: rgb(0, 162, 255);
        }

        #youtubecontact:hover {
            text-decoration: underline;
            color: rgb(0, 162, 255);
        }

        .contactinfo .box {
            position: relative;
            padding: 20px 0;
            display: flex;
        }

        .contactinfo .box {
            min-width: 60px;
            height: 60px;
        }

        @media (max-width:761px) {
            .h1 {
                display: none;
            }

            #okay {
                margin-top: 10px;
            }

            .errorways {
                font-size: 15px;
            }

            .thankyou #okay {
                font-size: 25px;
            }
        }

        @media (max-width:576px) {
            .thankyou #okay {
                font-size: 30px;
            }
        }
    </style>
</head>

<body>
    <section>
        <div class="thankyou">
            <h1 class="h1">
                Error While Sending Message
            </h1>

            <p id="okay">
                Error while Sending Message Please try again later
            </p>

            <div class="errorways">
                <h2 id="tryanounce" style="font-weight: 400; color: black;">
                    You can Try these things:-
                </h2>
                <div class="errorways2">
                    <p>
                        Checking Your Connection To The Internet
                    </p>
                    <p>
                        Contacting to us in our <a href="#"
                            id="youtubecontact">YouTube Channel</a>
                    </p>
                </div>
            </div>
            <p id="namedrf">Your Company or Website name</p>

            <div class="anchor" style="margin-bottom: 50px;">
                <a href="#">Watch Videos</a>
                <a href="#">Back To Home</a>
                <a href="index.html">Contact Us</a>
            </div>

        </div>
    </section>
</body>

</html>
